meanings.definition: A person who is slow to understand or perceive things.
meanings.sent1: The teacher patiently explained the math problem to the dullards in the class.
meanings.sent2: The dullards in the group took longer to grasp the concept compared to the others.
meanings.sent3: The dullards at the puzzle party struggled to find the missing piece.
meanings.sent4: Among the bright stars of the class, the dullards shone dimly.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dullards scratching their heads in confusion stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A group of people who lack intelligence or are boring.
meanings.sent1: The party was a bore with the dullards sitting in the corner, talking about the weather.
meanings.sent2: The dullards in the office always made the meetings drag on longer than necessary.
meanings.sent3: The dullards at the comedy show didn't seem to get any of the jokes.
meanings.sent4: The dullards in the crowd were like a black hole, sucking the energy out of the room.
meanings.sent5: The dullards in the library made the atmosphere as exciting as a rainy day.
